name: 鄭孟淙
objective: This course trains students in analyzing and solving design issues using data-backed methods, focusing on the evidence-based design process. It covers data collection, analysis, and application in design decisions, introducing various research tools and techniques. The curriculum emphasizes practical application through lectures, workshops, and research projects, aiming at continuously improving design solutions. Key skills include understanding evidence-based design principles, mastering research methods and tools for data analysis, and developing critical thinking to optimize design direction based on research findings.
schedule:
1. Introduction to the Study of Street Furniture and Seating Selection
2. Observation and Evaluation of Body Supports
3. Research on Indoor and Outdoor Simulated Mobility (Stations, Hospitals, Campuses)
4. Study on Outdoor Environmental Behavior I (Motorcycle Parking, Play Equipment)
5. Study on Outdoor Environmental Behavior II (Communal Dining Behavior, Public Restroom Usage)
6. Study on Outdoor Environmental Behavior III (Spot Checks, Queuing)
7. Evidence-Based Design of Horticultural Therapy
8. Midterm Report
9. Midterm Report

10. Wayfinding Signage Study I (Directional Signage)
11. Wayfinding Signage Study II (Map Signage)
12. Indicator Trends Study (Mobile/AR/Voice)
13. Recycling Truck Project Study
14. Public Interface Study I
15. Public Interface Study II
16. Medical Interface Study (PDA)
17. Final Report
18. Final Report
